data.title: Large hamburger
data.text: The burgers were great and very large, consider splitting.  Lots of choices I had the superb burger with curly fries, very good.  Sit of a dive bar but great food

data.title: WOW! New Owners hitting it out of the ballpark!
data.text: We haven't been to the Elk Grove Sport Bar in quite a while since I was not going due to lack of upkeep by old owners. Since the Sox were on, we decided to go back to see if things had changed and  they certainly have done so for the better!   More lighting around the bar area, new paint, some new employees, and the burger was FANTASTIC! The bacon.....AH!  My guys club sandwich was delicious (but he is not writing this review so.....the BURGER!!!). Nice, friendly, warm greetings when we arrived, staff engaged in a discussion about the blues. More like the Cheers bar on that old television show. Nice.

data.title: Yep this is a dive bar
data.text: The place is a total five but the food here is great!  Had the mushroom Swiss burger minus the bacon and an order of zucchini.  Everything was very good.

data.title: Better be better - Decent place to spend time
data.text: It has approx 35-40 belt, i missed the rush over there, after a point of time i wanted to leave, you have limited food options

data.title: Dive bar with great sliders
data.text: This place is a total dive bar!  This is a fun place to eat a good burger and play pool with a bunch of friends.  Try their sliders!  Yummy!  They also have kareoke late at night!

data.title: Great Energy!
data.text: Friday night. My first time. Great atmosphere. Very friendly, open hospitality. The staff seemed to know most people and helped celebrate one of the regulars' birthday. Great possitive energy. Reasonable prices.

data.title: Average Local Drinking Hole
data.text: Fair price for drinks and a romping night of drunkin karaoke! They were gracious enough to let me sing once considering I wasn't a regular but it is a local establishment for neighborhood people so don't expect to get treated special or anything.

data.title: You wont go away hungry
data.text: This has been a favorite for family and friends for a long time.  Be prepared for a lot of food.  Game night can get crowded so come early.

data.title: Ugh, dive bar, bad band, most patrons are dregs of society
data.text: Ok, being relatively new to the area, I went with a friend to this place after going for sushi. The band was so bad, the lead was off key all night. This was the 2nd Saturday of March. I will never return. Dirty, honky tonk. No thanks.

data.title: Some Sports, a Little Grill
data.text: The service is modest but not offensive. The food is average or below, more likely the lesser of those two ratings. There are several good-size TV sets around the rooms and one theater type. However, when we went there at mid-day to see the final World Cup of Soccer game, it wasn't even on until we requested it. Since there was only one other person there, it wasn't a problem. The  bar service was decent and the bartender (the only service person in the bar & grill) was enjoyable. Still, it was a quiet and uninteresting place to visit unless one has been unable to find a bar with soccer on it in the Elk Grove area and doesn't want to drive to Sacramento to meet one's needs.

data.title: Beer cheap, food was awful
data.text: Great place to visit if you don't need to have a conversation with anyone and enjoy watching a dozen different games at the same time and are not hungry. Recently visited one night while attending the Ryder Cup in Medinah. Cavernous facility that as packed for the Thursday night game. Beer a very reasonable $2:50 but the food, even by sports bar standards was terrible. Only non-fried thing on the menu was a burger. 6 oz burger came on a very stale and in-edible bun that was three times the size of the burger, topped with a massive piece of dill and a sorry leaf of lettuce. Out and back at the hotel by the end of the first quarter.  Don't bother.
